snippet: Wolfgang Pichler, who was hired to help Russia prepare for Sochi, said that he brought his suspicions to the Russian biathlon federation late last year, but that nothing was done.
abstract: Wolfgang Pichler, a prominent coach of the Russian biathlon team, says he knew that at least one Russian athlete was doping as far back as November 2013, more than two months before she and another Russian biathlete were suspended for doping violations; positive tests, right before the Sochi Olympics, have cast a shadow over the biathlon, a signature Russian sport that combines cross-country skiing with sharpshooting.
lead_paragraph: Wolfgang Pichler, who was hired to help Russia prepare for Sochi, said that he brought his suspicions to the Russian biathlon federation late last year, but that nothing was done.

headline.main: Russian Biathlon Coach Had Suspicions, Too
headline.print_headline: Russian Biathlon Coach Had Suspicions, Too
